Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Chazmainian Devil> CB is awesome!!!  Exactly 1 year ago I had a bad experience with Craptopia when they took all trading pairs for coins besides BTC down for three months. Shady.. plus rumors about what they do with POS and MN coins -- They would stake all the coins under the one wallet for the coin... and not remove them from staking till someone physically move the coins off the exchange. That can have evil effects on a POS coin. How decentralized is that anyways? If you are a POS or MN coin you are better off sticking to DEX's where that trick is not possible.  Good decision there!! Go VERUS! üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Chazmainian Devil> Wouldn't hurt to ask Cryptopia for a partial refund on their listing fee and also get delisted off of it..Because of what I mentioned above with staking... Taking what you get back, add it to CB funding and disassociate  Verus from Cryptopia completely.  What Cryptopia had happen is not what a new coin wants happening from the start.  Stick with the DEX's  P2P is what it always should have been.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> @Chazmainian Devil that is a shame and an interesting point, I never really considered that- large exchanges staking for the coins they hold. I wonder if it would have a large centralizing effect for the larger exchanges

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Chazmainian Devil> Most definitely!   Think about how long people have coins on those exchanges and not in their wallet??? Yikes! Murder for staking coins.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> It would be nice if cryptopia did issue some sort of refund for the deposit but I would be really surprised if that happened and I wouldn't hold my breath for it. Like you said I guess it wouldn't really hurt

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> @Chazmainian Devil any idea how many coins are on digital price at any given time? Cryptopia is much larger so I can imagine. This is the first time I've heard that brought up though but it doesn't not make sense

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Chazmainian Devil> Yes, doesn't hurt to try to get the fee back but also would be a BIG plus if VERUS was only listed on P2P or DEX exchanges.  All listing a POS coin on a non-P2P exchange does  is devalue the staking coin and centralize it at the same time. All the coins they make is pure profit...and you then can imagine what they could do with price manipulation or when they "Sell" all of those staked coins.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> Yes but at the same time it shouldn't be that massive in the scheme of things, like the max amount they'd ever have would have to be a really huge amount staking against the full current total supply to have a centralizing effect

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Chazmainian Devil> Consider DEX only. All you would see in block explorer is small addresses from 500-1000 coins which are called nodes in the Staking world.  On non-DEX exchanges you would have to add all the coins on the exchange up for Sell orders to understand the size of their wallet in coins that they could potentially stake.  Bigger non-Dex  exchange you get the worse it gets and the faster the coin is devalued.  DEX only please!!! üòÉ  I forgot that you also have to add all of the coins on the exchange that do not have a sell order on them too... See how bad the situation snowballs on Non-DEX?
